author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> Hi!

Our Performance Tests are now running on EEST!
First results are already on Modexp-repricing tests:
https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/feo4ronhsqv40e/opcodes-benchmarking-modexp-repricing?orgId=1&from=now-6h&to=now&timezone=browser&var-posgreSQL=benuragv7iuwwb&var-ClientName=erigon&var-ClientName=geth&var-ClientName=nethermind&var-ClientName=reth&var-ClientName=besu&var-TestTitle=$__all&refresh=auto&editIndex=2

Worst scenarios after repricing which will be interesting for 100MGas+ increases are:
*besu* - tests_benchmark_test_worst_compute.py__test_worst_modexp[fork_Prague-benchmark-blockchain_test_engine_x_from_state_test-mod_vul_guido_3_even] - *27.1 MGas/s*
*geth* - tests_benchmark_test_worst_compute.py__test_worst_modexp[fork_Prague-benchmark-blockchain_test_engine_x_from_state_test-mod_even_32b_exp_40] - *29.5 MGas/s*
*geth* - tests_benchmark_test_worst_compute.py__test_worst_modexp[fork_Prague-benchmark-blockchain_test_engine_x_from_state_test-mod_exp_208_gas_balanced] - *33.1 MGas/s*
*geth* - tests_benchmark_test_worst_compute.py__test_worst_modexp[fork_Prague-benchmark-blockchain_test_engine_x_from_state_test-mod_vul_common_200n3] - *38.1 MGas/s*
*geth* - tests_benchmark_test_worst_compute.py__test_worst_modexp[fork_Prague-benchmark-blockchain_test_engine_x_from_state_test-mod_vul_common_200n2] - *38.8 MGas/s*

In case you want to check something custom or refresh the image base - these are running on your *performance-modexp* branches.

cc @vdWijden @amezianehamlat

author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> Main dashboard (with ALL EEST tests from 0.0.4 benchmark release) are running - close to an end now and obviously as EEST combined with gas-benchmark covers much more - is a bit slower - but will work on that.

Will appear soon here:
https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/feo4ronhsqv40d/opcodes-benchmarking?orgId=1&from=now-6h&to=now&timezone=browser&var-posgreSQL=benuragv7iuwwb&var-ClientName=$__all&var-TestTitle=$__all&refresh=auto&editIndex=2

author: bridge-bot
content: <chfast> Nice. Can we now enable full Fusaka for performance-modexp instead of testing a custom config?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> re: **@chfast**
> Nice. Can we now enable full Fusaka for performance-modexp instead of testing a custom config?
Will discuss with STEEL - there were some issues still with that on benchmarks-x suites. But yeah ideally I want to make performance-modexp dashboard to run fusaka branches (or whatever client teams uses) and keep monitoring on that.
